fields.question: What are collaborative communities?
fields.answer: The portal for ‘Collaborative Communities’ will allow individual users to form communities, participate in various activities defined within the community, and thus, enhance its value for the society in terms of education.

fields.question: Why do we need collaborative communities?
fields.answer: ‘Collaborative Communities’ helps us to know what other communities can offer and share resources  to achieve a common goal.

fields.question: What type of collaborative communities will you find?
fields.answer: You will find communities from various education fields which come together and contribute to it.

fields.question: What are the key features of collaborative communities?
fields.answer: Collaborative Communities allow a particular community to share resources and idea. It also increases the community awareness.

fields.question: How to register on this website?
fields.answer: Click on 'Sign-Up' button on the top right corner, and fill the required details as prompted.

fields.question: I have forgotten my password. What should I do?
fields.answer: Click on forgot password message and enter your email id. You will receive a link to your email for resetting your password.

fields.question: What is a community?
fields.answer: Set of people coming together to achieve a common goal by sharing ideas and information by performing various activities within it.

fields.question: What is a group?
fields.answer: A group is nothing but a sub-community which is formed by a group of people of a particular community.

fields.question: How to join a community?
fields.answer:
Navigate to 'Collaborative Communities' homepage. Assuming that you have logged in, click ‘Communities’ and then click on any desired community. Click ‘Join us’
You will now be an 'Author' in the community.

fields.question: How to leave a community?
fields.answer: Navigate to the desired community and click ‘Unsubscribe' and follow the steps given on the screen.

fields.question: How do I know which communities I am subscribed to?
fields.answer: Assuming that you have logged in, click on your username > ‘Dashboard’. You will be able to see your subscribed communities under ‘My Communities’

fields.question: Can I create a community?
fields.answer: No, you cannot create a community. In case you feel the need of a community and it does not make sense in creating a group under a community, only then you may request for creation of a community. You may do so by clicking your username and ‘Request community creation’. Fill the details and follow the instructions.

fields.question: What are the different roles?
fields.answer: Roles are associated with a community and group. A community has (a) author, (b) publisher, and (c) community admin; while a group has (a) author, (b) publisher, and (c) group admin, i.e. a person can be an author in one community/group, a publisher in other, and admin in other. Each of these roles have some set of privileges.

fields.question: Who is an author and what are the privileges?
fields.answer: An author is a member of a community or group who can contribute by creating resources like basic articles and groups in a community.

fields.question: Who is a publisher and what are the privileges?
fields.answer: A publisher is a member of a community or group who has all the privileges as that of an author but is also responsible for publishing articles contributed by other authors in that community/group.

fields.question: Who is an admin of community/group and what are the privileges?
fields.answer:
An admin of a community or group has all the privileges as that of a publisher but is also responsible for maintaining the decorum of the community or group. He/she can edit the community/group information, change role of a member, and add or remove a member to/from community/group.

Note: The person requesting for a community becomes the community admin of that community. The person who creates a group in the community becomes the group admin of that group.

fields.question: Who can create a resource and how?
fields.answer: A resource is created in a community/group. Any member belonging to the community/group can create it. Go to the desired community/group and click 'Create Article'. Fill up the ‘title’, ‘body’, and ‘image (optional)’, and click 'Create'. Every resource created follows a workflow from its initial state to final (Publish) state. For more details, please refer to the questions in the 'Workflow' category.

fields.question: Who will publish my resource and when?
fields.answer: The publisher of the community/group publishes the resource. It will be published based on the states given in the workflow category.

fields.question: I am a publisher of a community/group, can I publish a resource created by me?
fields.answer: No, a publisher cannot publish the resource created by him/her. Other publishers belonging to that community/group can publish it.

fields.question: What is a workflow?
fields.answer: A workflow follows certain steps from initial state to the final state for a resource created by a member of community/group.

fields.question: What workflow is followed in a community/group?
fields.answer: The workflow goes from 'Draft' state to 'Visible, 'Publishable', and finally 'Publish' state in a community; while 'Draft' to 'Private', and finally 'Visible' state in a group. To know more about the states, refer respective questions given below.

fields.question: What is draft state?
fields.answer: When a resource is created, it is initially in this state. At this time only the person who has created it can view. This is true for community as well as group.

fields.question: What is visible state?
fields.answer:
This state belongs to community as well as group.
If a resource in the community is changed to 'Visible' state, the resource can be viewed and edited by all members of the community. Whereas if the resource in a group is changed to 'Visible' state, then all the members of the community can view it but cannot edit it.

fields.question: What is publishable state?
fields.answer: This state only belongs to the resource created in the community. In this state the resource is only visible to the community members. The publisher of the community will publish it or reject it.

fields.question: What is publish state?
fields.answer: In this state the resource is published and is visible to anonymous and authenticated users of the system as well. Once it is published then the resource cannot be edited by anyone.

fields.question: What is the flow of the state and who is authorised for changing the states.
How do I know which groups I am subscribed to?
fields.answer: Assuming that you have logged in, click on your username > ‘Dashboard’. You will be able to see your subscribed communities under ‘My Groups’

fields.question: What workflow is followed by a group?
fields.answer: The workflow goes from 'Draft' state to visible state in a group. To know about the states, refer respective questions given below.

fields.question: What is a draft state?
fields.answer: When a resource is created, it is initially in this state. At this time only the person who has created it can view.

fields.question: What is visible state?
fields.answer: Content is visible to all members of the community.  Members can comment and edit it.

fields.question: What are the responsibilities of group admin?
fields.answer: Any community member who creates a group in that particular community becomes a group admin of that particular group. He/she has the right to add/remove people to and from the group and change roles of the group members. He/she can make article visible.

fields.question: Information about a public group in a community and a private group in a community?
fields.answer: Community is always public and available for the authenticated user to join.  Public Group: There can be 0 to N public groups in a community. Any member of the community can create a public group and any member of the community can join it.  Private Group: There can be 0 to N private groups in a community. Any member of the community can create a private group but only invited members can join it.

fields.question: What type of resource tools are available for use?
fields.answer: As of now, our portal has 'Basic Article' as a tool to offer. We plan to offer other tools like video, audio, etc. as well, in our next release.

fields.question: How to join a group?
fields.answer: Navigate to 'Collaborative Communities' homepage. Assuming that you have logged in, click ‘Communities’ and then click on any desired community. You will see a list of groups in that community. Click on the desired group and click ‘Join us’ You will now be an 'Author' in the group.

fields.question: How to leave a group?
fields.answer: Navigate to the desired group and click ‘Unsubscribe' and follow the steps given on the screen.

fields.question: Can I create a group and how?
fields.answer: Yes, you can create a group under a community. Go to the desired community and check whether a similar group exists. Only if it does not exist, then you may create a group by clicking 'Create Group'. Fill in the details and follow the instructions on the screen.

fields.question: Can I edit a resource created by someone else
fields.answer: Yes, as name 'Collaborative Communities' suggests you can edit and collaborate resources created by other members of your community/group.

fields.question: Can I delete a resource
fields.answer: No, you cannot delete any resource, except the one which is created by you and is in its initial state (draft) only.

fields.question: What is private state?
fields.answer: This state only belongs to a group. When a resource from 'Draft' state is changed to 'Private' state, it can be viewed by all members of the group.
